entry.title: vt: Fix snapshots when browser controls are animating
entry.content:
This CL fixes snapshot capture when browser controls are animating.

Browser controls start animating to shown at navigation start. A capture

is started at navigation commit. If the animation is still running at

commit time, the capture is requested while controls are partially

showing, which requires some adjustments.



https://crrev.com/c/5366846 made it so that Blink is reliably resized

prior to capture. There are three additional adjustments made here:



1) We can now use `BrowserControls::ShrinkViewport`, which comes from

the resize, to determine whether to outset a snapshot.



2) Cancel the controls animation and force them to be fully shown when

the capture is requested. This ensures the transitioning elements will

be captured in the locations they'll appear in on the incoming page.



3) However, the controls animation can (conditionally) counter-scroll

the root scroller to give an effect of the controls overlaying the

content. This happens only if the page is not at the top[1]. To account

for this, the counter scroll is preemptively applied in Blink. However,

since the compositor may be ticking animations while Blink is running

the BeginMainFrame, we also implement a way to tell the compositor to

drop any active scroll delta since Blink has already scrolled to the

desired final position.



[1] https://crrev.com/5ef8262



Fixed: 40855375,41490049

Change-Id: I50605cc717eb6a4b09b80f14d41664406b883ad9

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5366098

Commit-Queue: David Bokan

Reviewed-by: Khushal Sagar

Reviewed-by: Dave Tapuska

entry.title: Avoid sending oversized display rects through ozone wayland
entry.content:
Wayland surface augmenter uses 'wl_fixed_t' which only supports scales

up to 23 bit integers. For some reason specific pages [1] create

malformed enormous quad rects. Since we cannot send these rects

through wayland we must fail delegation and composite.



[1]

https://gtowizard.com/en/





Bug: b/331241180

Change-Id: I68b02e8f061bc1029a987afe48afd90a267ded8e

entry.title: [PA] Add PRESUBMIT.py for PartitionAlloc include guards
entry.content:
Currently, all PartitionAlloc headers are include-guarded with a guard

name like `BASE_ALLOCATOR_PARTITION_ALLOCATOR_SRC_PARTITION_ALLOC_

PARTITION_ALLOC_H_`.



This does not match with the fact that recent update,

https://crbug.com/40276913, made it possible to include PA headers like:

```

#include "partition_alloc/partition_alloc_for_testing.h"

```



This chain of CLs will rewrite these include guards in three steps.

1. Allow-list PA directory from the top-level `PRESUBMIT.py` check for

include guard names.

[[ https://crrev.com/c/5384972 ]]

2. Rewrite existing PA headers to use new guard names.

[[ https://crrev.com/c/5384737 ]]

3. Add PA-level PRESUBMIT.py to enforce new guard names.

[[ This CL ]]



The new PRESUBMIT.py rule enforces a stricter rule over guard naming in

PA. It requires the name to be compliant with the style guide, as

commented in the script. The rule is tested against all existing headers

in PA locally and it is confirmed that all of them are using the

standard naming style.



Bug: 40276913

Change-Id: I71c5d3ab97b9cf1f9aa4cfe542e6c570e87f7360

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5384659

Reviewed-by: Arthur Sonzogni

Reviewed-by: Bartek Nowierski

Commit-Queue: Mikihito Matsuura

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1278939}

Currently, all PartitionAlloc headers are include-guarded with a guard

name like `BASE_ALLOCATOR_PARTITION_ALLOCATOR_SRC_PARTITION_ALLOC_

This does not match with the fact that recent update,

https://crbug.com/40276913, made it possible to include PA headers like:

This chain of CLs will rewrite these include guards in three steps.

entry.title: Mark DocumentToken on PrefetchContainerKey optional for browser-initiated prefetch
entry.content:
Currently, PrefetchContainer uses the referring DocumentToken and

prefetch_url pair as an identity key.

Regarding introducing browser-initiated prefetch, we need to revisit the

usage of DocumentToken since there will be no concept of the referring

DocumentToken in such triggers.



As the straightforward expansion of the current keying system to

browser-initiated prefetch, this CL marks DocumentToken optional to

allow PrefetchContainer to handle empty DocumentToken case.



This CL doesn't change any existing behavior of current speculation

rules prefetch.



Note that the current DocumentToken-based mechanism is planning to be

migrated to the NIK-based key system [1] in near future.

Please see [2] for more context and plan.



[1] https://docs.google.com/document/d/1z3BTb3jEfyvUJIFJCc7e9UKB5dIZlGRHFhpU8R_s66M



[2] https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Cr4MyJAA42c1m7MrEHgH_IIlKHA6EfiBdRGpP_RiDKQ/edit?resourcekey=0-ySgOZBi6gdfSRwe3ZYWOLA&tab=t.0#heading=h.vr3i7u9fzq01



Bug: 40946257, 40942681

Change-Id: If7b6c426a47ec4e0ed8cf9198f37b16201d1c86e

entry.title: PasswordSyncBridge: Stop using SyncMetadataStoreChangeList::TakeError()
entry.content:
SyncMetadataStoreChangeList::TakeError() is deprecated - this pattern

makes it too easy to accidentally forget to check for an error.

This CL migrates PasswordSyncBridge (the last user of TakeError()) to

the new pattern, which is passing an error callback to the

SyncMetadataStoreChangeList.

A followup CL will remove TakeError().



Bug: 40860762

entry.title: [PA] Exclude PA from toplevel PRESUBMIT.py include guard check
entry.content:
Currently, all PartitionAlloc headers are include-guarded with a guard

name like `BASE_ALLOCATOR_PARTITION_ALLOCATOR_SRC_PARTITION_ALLOC_

PARTITION_ALLOC_H_`.



This does not match with the fact that recent update,

https://crbug.com/40276913, made it possible to include PA headers like:

```

#include "partition_alloc/partition_alloc_for_testing.h"

```



This chain of CLs will rewrite these include guards in three steps.

1. Allow-list PA directory from the top-level `PRESUBMIT.py` check for

include guard names.

[[ This CL ]]

2. Rewrite existing PA headers to use new guard names.

[[ https://crrev.com/c/5384737 ]]

3. Add PA-level PRESUBMIT.py to enforce new guard names.

[[ https://crrev.com/c/5384659 ]]



Bug: 40276913

Change-Id: Iedbbce834fdfe36f48d3d062e42450cbb77bd8c0

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5384972

Reviewed-by: Daniel Cheng

Reviewed-by: Arthur Sonzogni

Commit-Queue: Mikihito Matsuura

entry.title: [Clank][BrowsingDataModel] Hold a reference to the BDM on clank side
entry.content:
This CL implements various required interface methods to communicate

with the browsing data model such as:

- BuildFromDisk: builds the browsing data model from disk.

- FetchBrowsingDataInfo: retrieves all data in the browsing data model

as a Map to be used to populate all sites and

similar UI surfaces.

- RemoveBrowsingData: removes browsing data for a certain host.

entry.title: [PriceInsights][iOS] Add price tracking UI
entry.content:
This CL adds the following:

- The main content view stack, which will hold the views of the different components of Price Insights

- The first component of Price Insights, Price Tracking UI. This component also displays the Price Range if the data is available together with price tracking.



Screenshots:

No variant price tracking and price range: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/AQKpcbPY8w8wTkK.png

Variant price tracking and price range: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/4qKkazvYm4GTHJV.png

Only price tracking: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/4zHAPtKB4FdNyb7.png

Only price range when price history is available

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/5Fr6fSBmarvPer5.png



This CL is missing the refactoring of PriceNotificationTrackButton to allow toggling between track and untrack.



Bug: b/326449938

entry.title: kiosk: Introduce KioskVision
entry.content:
The KioskVision class is responsible for the Kiosk Vision ML feature.

None of the real functionality is present at this stage. Currently the

object listens to pref changes and installs a (not yet existent) DLC.



This aims to start landing the object hierarchies, and get some of the

pieces in place. Many details like prefs used or the DLC

install/uninstall flow are likely to change.



Bug: b:330707096

Test: testing/xvfb.py tools/autotest.py -C out/Release chrome/browser/ash/app_mode/vision/kiosk_vision_unittest.cc

addresses per users. Since we commonly get asked about these numbers,

entry.title: [UPMLocalPwd] Remove sync callback null CHECK from the local backend
entry.content:
The local android password store backend used to CHECK that the sync

callback it gets passed is null. This was a way to clarify for the

callers that the sync callback wouldn't be used, so they should

only pass a null one.



However, the account android backend has started using this callback

and requires it to be not null. The caller,

AndroidBackendWithDoubleDeletion, cannot make the difference between a

local backend and an account backend so a non-null callback now makes it into the local backend too.



=> the CHECK needs to be removed. A comment at the caller level documents the fact that the local backend doesn't use that callback.



Bug: 331517808, 321220529

Change-Id: Iff3aa1d0048e2c4cc54fc4cc8dc59260b75648ca

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5398104

Reviewed-by: Karol Sygiet

As part of PnP request, adds a new limit to the image search indexing.

entry.title: [iOS] Move tab/group utils closer to WebStateList
entry.content:
This change should be a no-op.

Those utils are not linked to the tab switchers. They should be part of

the WebStateList.

Move them to the web_state_list folder.



In particular:

- Move the IsPinnedTabsEnabled to the main features file

- Move all the utils related to the TabGroup colors to static methods

in the TabGroup class

- Move the utils related to groups to their own file

- Move CloseAllOtherTabs to the bottom of WebStateList with the

other batch close functions and make it take a ref.

- Move the utils related to WebState lookup/mutation to their own file



Bug: None

entry.content:
This patch should be cherry-picked in M124.

Bug introduced with crrev.com/c/5386141.



MiniMapInterstitialViewController and NotificationsOptInViewController

are subclasses of PromoStyleViewController and they both override

-[PromoStyleViewController titleLabelFontTextStyle].



This patch make sure the value for -[self titleLabelFontTextStyle] is

used to generate the title font.

entry.title: [iOS] Add -agentFromApp to ObservingAppAgent
entry.content:
Adds a general utility method to ObservingAppAgent to allow retrieving

the agent if it's already been created; this is symmetrical with

similar APIs for SceneStateAgents, Browser Agents, and tab helpers.



Existing AppStateAgents that don't subclass ObservingAppAgent can be trivially converted (assuming they are at least also AppSateObservers).



(Also updated all the test names in app_state_unittest to begin with capital letters, and switched the corresponding method in

ObservingSceneStateAgent to use -isMemberOfClass)



Change-Id: Id666ada2aabf827f444649c353612bcc86180228

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5397456

entry.title: PA: Audit broken links in docs
entry.content:
A number of our links - e.g. to structs and functions - have broken,

despite being anchored on a specific known-good revision. I have no idea

exactly why.



This CL



* removes some links (just mentioning the basenames of pertinent

files) and



* changes most links to code into reproducible Chromium CodeSearch

queries. This obviates having to anchor to an ever-aging revision.



Fixed: 330207625

entry.title: Fix the issue of InstanceRegistryUpdater not observing Env.
entry.content:
InstanceRegistryUpdater is a aura::EnvObserver but never calls

aura::Env::AddObserver so it does not receive events from the source.



This means that aura::EnvObserver overrides and aura::WindowObserver

overrides were never called.



This patch fixes that issue.



Bug: b/330124317

entry.title: Fix flaky tests in TabDragging for LACROS due to asynchronous closure
entry.content:
`DesktopWindowTreeHost::Close()` delays closure with PostTask. The top

`RunLoop` might quit prematurely, resulting in an incorrect

`BrowserList::size()` during tests. This CL introduces observer to

guarantee accurate `BrowserList::size()` in tests.



Bug: 41468034, 1031801

entry.content:
This is a preparation for using the ServiceEndpoint Request API for

QUIC connection attempts. See [1] for the overall approach. [2] is a

proof-of-concept CL. Changed the signature to take `ConnectionMetadata`

instead of `HostResolverEndpointResult` since the new API uses

`ServiceEndpoint` instead of `HostResolverEndpointResult`.



[1] https://docs.google.com/document/d/1RQ7WjsRCItn05SHKQBfBwfOKlyoFoWL3KqdwKDOT6s8/edit?usp=sharing

[2] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5334880



Bug: 331271919

entry.title: [FspCache] Plumb through CloudFileInfo via the OpenFile callback
entry.content:
CL:5343674 introduced the CloudFileInfo to the FSP API on a number of

methods. This begins plumbing the struct via the OpenFile callback to

make it useful to the implementations. The one that cares the most is

the CloudFileSystem which will use it to indicate any version changes

for the underlying files that it ends up tracking via the content cache.

entry.title: Support ReadAndDiscardBody in http disk prewarm
entry.content:
Optionally use the DownloadHeadersOnly() method of SimpleURLLoader in

PrewarmHttpDiskCacheManager. Together with the

kSimpleURLLoaderUseReadAndDiscardBodyOption feature this avoids copying

body data to the browser process, making prewarm more efficient.



BUG=331074430

entry.title: Cleanup printing preferences files
entry.content:
Update prefs_util files so that they only contain functions that

directly read preferences. Move wrapper functions which encapsulate

feature helpers for out-of-process printing for checking both feature

flags and policies into new oop_features files.



Expose the previously encapsulated CheckOopPolicy() function from

prefs_util.h. Update its signature to return an optional, so that

callers can distinguish explicit preference values from no preference

specified.



Change-Id: I1c44e25972ac206f5d43ec351a31afb5196a0bc1

entry.title: QA+Mahi: Use ReadWriteCardsUiController for QuickAnswersView
entry.content:
Instead of using its own widget, QuickAnswersView now use

ReadWriteCardsUiController to manage its widget. In order to achieve

this, we introduce a new function in ReadWriteCardsView that determines

the extra reserved height a view can take, which will be used in the

widget bounds calculations.

entry.title: Revert "DOM: Process `<meta>` tags synchronously upon insertion"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 4e0f59bc7ba847e0a519bab4821e4dd1c1d6bb78.



Reason for revert: Lots of crashes in https://crbug.com/330694762.



I will try and investigate and re-land soon, but for now I'll revert

just to stabilize things.



Original change's description:

> DOM: Process `` tags synchronously upon insertion

>

> The HTML Standard currently processes and applies *all* `` tags

> synchronously upon insertion, during the node's "insertion steps"

> (indirectly).

>

> Before this CL, Chromium would process meta tags during the

> post-insertion steps however, by having HTMLMetaElement::InsertedInto()

> return

> `InsertionNotificationRequest::kInsertionShouldCallDidNotifySubtreeInsertions`,

> so that `HTMLMetaElement::DidNotifySubtreeInsertionsToDocument()` would

> be called, which would process the meta tag appropriately.

>

> This CL simplifies the meta tag processing model to process meta tags

> synchronously upon insertion (i.e., `InsertedInto()`), which passes the

> remaining two relevant WPTs, and aligns the Chromium with the HTML

> Standard.

>

> The observable effect of this are:

> - `` tags get applied synchronously during

> insertion, such that script elements inserted atomically *after* it

> can observe the document's *new* referrer policy

> - `` also apply synchronously, which

> means than an http-equiv value that assigns the default style sheet

> ensures that the proposed style sheet is assigned synchronously. This

> matches the fact that `

entry.title: Revert "[AvatarButton] Fix signin paused state not clearing on signout + cleanup"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 97e5f0c6015dfc996b4281fcd593e9f908c9366c.



Reason for revert: consistent crash across multiple platforms upon browser launch, b/331499330



Original change's description:

> [AvatarButton] Fix signin paused state not clearing on signout + cleanup

>

> Signin paused state was not active anymore, and signing out of Chrome

> did not trigger a state change. Listening to primary account change

> fixes the issue.

>

> Refactoring parts:

> - Cleaned up the StateManager code to only compute new state

> internally or by request of StateProvider implementations, to make

> sure all the states control the active state and updates properly.

> - Injected specific logic of some StateProviders from the

> AvatarToolbarButtonDelegate into the StateProvider itself, and

> give a way to retrieve the StateProvider from the StateManager

> to read the value, when that State is the button active state.

> - Removed the icon related updates from the StateManager as they

> should not alter the state.

>

> Bug: b:329802297

> Change-Id: I0728747601de816cfe477a1ad2356c1e4b6bebb3

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5380711
